title: Which musical instruments go well with lead guitar and drums? - Quora

response.answer_text: Bass guitar - it has to be there to fill the pockets. It is the best friend of the Drum kit.And if needed can also be used to write cool riffs , if a band has only 1 guitar .Rythm Guitar - it can be either Acoustic or Electric . Acoustic will always give a chirpyness to the song, and make it feel earthly.whereas an electric guitar for rythk would just dynamically enhance the sound drastically . just playing itclean on the verses , and adding distortion for the chorus can fill the song in a brilliant way , and allows the lead guitarist to just experiment .if a song doesn't need a full sound , the rythm guitar can also give some harmonies .Keyboard - nothing beats the sound of a piano . But to the average human ear, the piano mode of any keyboard should work fine. Apart from that a tactical use of “strings” sound , and different “pads” can only add to the ambience of a song.These are the must have instruments . On top of that you can add about any instrument on earth , and they will sound fine, as long as the basic sound is good using the above instruments .

Bass guitar An important part of music, you can't take out the low frequencies from the music Drums and bass complete the rhythm groove. The electric guitar can fill inthe lead , along with lovely strumming or riffs from a rhythm guitar. Cello It's a good piece of music instrument, looks like a big fat violin stand up right. It gives a good harmony to the groove When rhythm guitar and bass and drums dance in a rhythm groove Saxophone Saxophone and lead guitar can have a good conversation on the stage exchanging lovely notes with awesome feel . A synthesiser Make your tones and chords heavenly with synthesiser which lays a nice carpet of tones under the groove and let the vocals and guitars walk into the lime light
